Steve Blake , traded to Milwaukee in the offseason and acquired by Denver from the Bucks last week, had a career-high 25 points against his former team Sunday night, in Denver's 109-93 victory over Portland. I'm not surprised because a good basketball player is a good basketball player and that's what he is, said Steve Blake 's new teammate, Allen Iverson . Allen Iverson had 32 points and nine assists for the Nuggets, who trailed at halftime but outscored the Blazers 41-17 in the third quarter. The victory snapped a two-game losing streak

Several major pieces have been stolen from the Egyptian museum, including a statue of King Tutankhamun, Egypt's minister of state for antiquities Zahi Hawass said on Sunday. The objects missing from the famed museum included a gilded wood statue of the 18th Dynasty king Tutankhamun being carried by a goddess and parts of ''a gilded wood statue of Tutankhamun harpooning,'' Zahi Hawass said in a statement. Andy Coulson , who will remain in Downing Street for a fortnight, said: Unfortunately continued coverage of events connected to my old job at the News of the World has made it difficult for me to give the 110% needed in this role. I stand by what I've said about those events but when the spokesman needs a spokesman it's time to move on. Andy Coulson is one of the most trusted members of David Cameron 's inner circle, with an apparent direct line to swing voters and News International. by the ongoing scandal. He still denies wrongdoing but felt the publicity made it impossible for him to get on with his job, said one friend. In a statement the Prime Minister said: I am very sorry that Andy Coulson has decided to resign as my Director of Communications, although I understand that the continuing pressures on him and his family mean that he feels compelled to do so. '' Andy Coulson has told me that the focus on him was impeding his ability to do his job and was starting to prove a distraction for the Government. The room erupted in applause after one delegate at today's event quizzed Steve Ballmer on the fine print in MS licensing, which could trip up unwary users. Steve Ballmer says he has no plans to simplify licensing. Customers want simplification to reduce costs; our shareholders want simplification without price decreases. Someone may choose a processor based licence for SQL Server, while another may decide on a server-based client access licence. Both offer lower costs depending on how they are deployed.
